summary: In the Arctic, warming temperatures and melting sea ice have opened new shipping routes but have also increased climate risks and international economic competition. Addressing these issues is a strategic priority for the U.S. government. We testified on factors that U.S. and foreign stakeholders identified that may help advance U.S. priorities, such as creating a new Ambassador for the Arctic region and providing scientific expertise...
title: Arctic Region: Factors That Affect the Advancement of U.S. Priorities
